meanings.definition: The quality or state of being vaporous.
meanings.sent1: The vaporousness of the mist made it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The morning air had a light vaporousness to it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the vaporousness of the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams had a vaporousness that seemed to slip away upon waking.
meanings.sent5: The vaporousness of the clouds created a dreamy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The tendency to evaporate or become vapor.
meanings.sent1: The heat caused the rapid vaporousness of the water in the pot.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the vaporousness of different liquids under varying temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the disappearing puddle was attributed to its vaporousness.
meanings.sent4: The vaporousness of the steam rising from the cup resembled a ghostly figure.
meanings.sent5: The vaporousness of the fog lifted as the sun rose higher in the sky.

meanings.definition: The quality of being insubstantial or lacking in substance.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the vaporousness of the ghost in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The idea of time travel had a certain vaporousness to it.
meanings.sent3: The argument fell apart due to the vaporousness of the evidence presented.
meanings.sent4: Her promises had a vaporousness that left others doubtful of their fulfillment.
meanings.sent5: The vaporousness of the rumor spread quickly through the small town.
